definition.@value: A structured, speech-bubble-driven comic format that conveys Type 2 endoleak mechanism, imaging criteria, and management decisions without external narration.

statement.text: Comic-style panels with speech bubbles can translate Type 2 endoleak research concepts—retrograde collateral inflow, sac growth thresholds, imaging phases, and embolization options—into a self-contained narrative accessible to trainees and patients.
statement.formal: Interactive visual storytelling embeds key data elements (sac diameter change ≥5mm as intervention trigger, delayed CTA/CEUS blush persistence, source vessel identification, embolization routes) into dialogue-driven panels, preserving clinical accuracy while lowering cognitive load.

explanation.intuition: Learners follow characters who ask and answer the same questions clinicians do, making the algorithm memorable.
explanation.key_insight: Speech bubbles replace side-text, so all reasoning and safety criteria must appear in-character to remain self-explanatory.
explanation.technical_details: Panels should explicitly display: sac size trends, source vessel arrows, imaging phase labels, and management thresholds; include bilingual cues where helpful; and cap text per bubble to maintain readability.

risks_if_missing: Understating rupture risk when sac expands
Omitting follow-up cadence leading to delayed detection

clinical_alignment.validated_by: vascular surgery teaching heuristics and SVS follow-up thresholds
